docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 25 -- A five-member negotiating committee appointed by the United Nations reported today that it had not been able to come to an agreement with the Union of South Africa on the future of the former mandated territory of...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 25 -- A five-member negotiating committee appointed by the United Nations reported today that it had not been able to come to an agreement with the Union of South Africa on the future of the former mandated territory of South-West Africa.
docs.abstract: special UN comm repts inability to agree with Union on area's future; plans further efforts

headline.main: U. N. FAILS TO AGREE ON SOUTH-WEST AFRICA

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: British sterling and the Canadian dollar vied with one another last week as new highs for this movement were marked up in each. Markets were extremely active and notwithstanding what might be termed lack of leadership on the part of this center last...
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling and the Canadian dollar vied with one another last week as new highs for this movement were marked up in each. Markets were extremely active and notwithstanding what might be termed lack of leadership on the part of this center last Thursday when we were closed down for the Thanksgiving Day holiday, firm markets were maintained in London and the cities of the Dominion.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Nov. 28, 1952.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 1 -- France, which has sought to avoid discussing the situation of the Arabs in Tunisia and Morocco in the Political Committee of the United Nations, took the occasion today to defend the French administration of the North...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 1 -- France, which has sought to avoid discussing the situation of the Arabs in Tunisia and Morocco in the Political Committee of the United Nations, took the occasion today to defend the French administration of the North African areas in connection with agrarian reform.
docs.abstract: Sen Dulin describes to UN com French efforts to aid rural life, N Africa

headline.main: FRANCE TELLS U. N. OF AFRICAN GAINS; Spokesman Recounts Agrarian Reforms and Expenditures to Better Natives' Lives

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 3 -- A group of small countries crushed a move in the General Assembly's Trusteeship Committee today to form a new alignment of nations favoring a policy of moderation in the handling of colonial affairs.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 3 -- A group of small countries crushed a move in the General Assembly's Trusteeship Committee today to form a new alignment of nations favoring a policy of moderation in the handling of colonial affairs.
docs.abstract: approved; com regrets Trusteeship Council failure; action marks small countries victory

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 5 -- The newspaper men of eleven Latin-American countries attending a press congress here voted today to organize a Latin-American Confederation of Journalists. Action was taken in a special meeting outside the regular procedure...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 5 -- The newspaper men of eleven Latin-American countries attending a press congress here voted today to organize a Latin-American Confederation of Journalists. Action was taken in a special meeting outside the regular procedure of the World Congress of Journalists meeting here.
docs.abstract: newsmen of 11 nations vote to form Latin-Amer Journalists Confed; spokesmen say move is not directed against N Amer

headline.main: LATIN JOURNALISTS FORM OWN GROUP; Delegates From 11 American Countries at Santiago Congress Organize Regional Body

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 6 -- Senator Angel Maria Cusano of Uruguay introduced today before the United Nations General Assembly's Economic and Financial Committee a draft proposal to reaffirm the right of each country to nationalize and exploit...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 6 -- Senator Angel Maria Cusano of Uruguay introduced today before the United Nations General Assembly's Economic and Financial Committee a draft proposal to reaffirm the right of each country to nationalize and exploit freely its natural wealth.
docs.abstract: Sen Cusano (Uruguay) offers proposal affirming right of each nation to nationalize and exploit natural wealth, UN com; Bolivian amendment would bar foreign Govts from intervention for their citizens as private investors; GB, Haiti and Sweden object; Syria backs principle with amendment; M Stahl (Sweden) holds proposal outside UN competence

headline.main: U. N. GETS PROPOSAL ON NATIONALIZING; Uruguayan Asks That Right of Every Nation to Exploit Wealth Be Reaffirmed

docs.snippet: THE first daily non-stop service between New York and Havana, Cuba, is announced by National Airlines starting Jan. 1. This is in addition to the company's two daily flights which at present stop at Miami or Washington and Tampa en route between the...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE first daily non-stop service between New York and Havana, Cuba, is announced by National Airlines starting Jan. 1. This is in addition to the company's two daily flights which at present stop at Miami or Washington and Tampa en route between the two countries.
docs.abstract: 4,221,000 tourists reptd, Jan-Sept; accommodations guide weighed
